snippet: Known to readers of The New Yorker’s “Talk of the Town” department simply as “our friend Janet,” the longtime executive director of the New York City Housing Authority Symphony was equal parts Holly Golightly, Auntie Mame and Mehitabel.
abstract: Janet Wolfe, vivacious executive director of New York City Housing Authority Symphony and inspiration behind The New Yorker’s Talk of the Town column from 1970s to 1990s, dies at age 101.
lead_paragraph: Known to readers of The New Yorker’s “Talk of the Town” department simply as “our friend Janet,” the longtime executive director of the New York City Housing Authority Symphony was equal parts Holly Golightly, Auntie Mame and Mehitabel.

headline.main: Janet Wolfe, Gothamite on a First-Name Basis With Her Era, Dies at 101
headline.print_headline: Janet Wolfe, 101, a Gleeful Gadabout Who Got the Town Talking, Is Dead
